intro: Plagiobothrys glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Plagiobothrys glomeratus is often found in California and Oregon, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils.
